sen.j: 寛和二年内裏歌合（かんなにねんだいりうたあわせ）は、寛和2年6月10日 (旧暦)（986年7月19日）、花山天皇によって行われた歌合。
sen.e: Kanna nine dairi Utaawase is an utaawase (poetry contest) held by Emperor Kazan on 19th July 986.
Kanna ninen dairi Utaawase is an utaawase (poetry contest) held by Emperor Kazan on the 19th of July, 986.
"Kanna ninen dairi Utaawase is an utaawase" (poetry contest) held by Emperor Kazan on July 24, 986.
sen.cmt: Kanna ninen dairi Utaawase にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。 19th of July, 986 をJuly 24, 986 に修正しました。※ 7月19日はユリウス暦でした。http://maechan.net/kanreki/

sen.j: 花山天皇は和歌に対する関心が深く、前年の寛和元年8月10日にも歌合を開催している。
sen.e: Emperor Kazan was deeply interested in waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and held another utaawase on 2nd July 985.
sen.cmt: 原文の旧暦の日付を計算で現在の暦に直しました。
sen.e: Emperor Kazan was deeply interested in waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and held another utaawase on the 2nd of July, 985.

sen.j: 判者は天皇の外戚権中納言藤原義懐が務め、講師は左方は当時21歳の藤原公任が抜擢された。
sen.e: Hanja (referee) was FUJIWARA no Yoshichika, a maternal relative of Emperor and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), and FUJIWARA no Kinto who was 21 years old at that time was elected to be koji (presenter of a poem) of the left side.

sen.j: 講師以外で参加した歌人として知られているのは、大中臣能宣・藤原惟成・藤原実方・曾禰好忠・藤原敦信・藤原明理・藤原道綱・藤原道長・藤原斉信らである。

sen.e: In addition to famous kajin such as Yoshinobu and Yoshitada, it is remarkable that Michinaga and Tadanobu, young nobles of almost same generation as Emperor took part.

sen.j: 和歌は20題20番であるが、歌題は四季の景物18と「祝」「恋」の人事題各1題ずつである。
sen.e: Participants were required to make twenty poems for twenty Kadai (subject of waka Japanese poem), including eighteen subjects related to four seasons and two subjects about human affairs, "celebration" and "love affairs" respectively.

sen.j: この歌合からわずか13日後、花山天皇は突如出家をして退位、義懐・惟成もこれに続いた。
sen.e: Only thirteen days after this utaawase, Emperor Kazan suddenly abdicated the throne to become a priest, followed by Yoshichika and Koreshige.

sen.e: Emperor Ichijo who was seven years old at that time ascended the throne, and political power shifted from Onomiya line to Kujo line.
